attributes.action: Reassure the public that taxpayers money will not be misspent on ludicrous TV campaigns such as 'Jeremy Kyle Gets Britain Working'.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Jeremy Kyle is wholly unsuitable to address the 'welfare to work' issue that is of current concern.
His personal life is hardly exemplary; furthermore his public persona appears to be that of an egoistic, patronising individual whose chief motivation is making himself look superior at the expense of others.
Recent media opinion is that approval of such a campaign would 'raise questions about the government's judgement' & 'taint government policy with the misanthropic cynicism of Kyle's current TV output'.
In addition, a report by the Joseph Rowntree Foundation suggests his programme 'could be viewed as... brutal entertainment that is based on derision of the lower-working-class population'.
The £400K rumoured to be allocated for this programme could surely be put to better, and more effective, use.
